data.name: (512) Brewing Company
data.description: (512) Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in the heart of Austin, brewing for the community using as many local, domestic and organic ingredients as possible. The original practice of small breweries supplying their immediate community has been nearly lost, and with it, the quality that is possible from small handcrafted batches. Our beers are built on old world English and Belgian recipes, but enhanced to celebrate bold domestic ingredients. Made with Austin’s mineral rich water, the (512) beers taste like none other.

data.name: 10 Barrel Brewing Company
data.description: We brew into a 10 Barrel Brewhouse, giving us the freedom to experiment with our recipes in order to produce the highest quality of beer that we can.  This isn’t just any 10 Barrel brewhouse though, it’s a state of the art system that allows us to blend new technology with the tradition of craft fundamentals.  In other words we can’t produce a TON of beer, but we can make it the highest quality.

data.name: 101 North Brewing Company
data.description:
Just a bunch of reckless boys who aren’t afraid to put the cart before the horse, twist every arm, break every sweat, and genuinely fake it till we make it. Because in these troubled times, creating and sharing beer with the world just made sense, if we could do it our way... with visual aids and a soundtrack.

At 101 North, we believe progressive is a beer style.

data.name: 14th Star Brewing
data.description:
History books tell us that local Vermonter and beer enthusiast Ethan Allen was a leader inthe effort to make Vermont the fourteenth star on the U.S. flag in 1791. And those textbooks are right; especially about the 1791 part.

Today, in Franklin County, Vermont, Army veteran Steve Gagner is honoring his home state and passion – brewing great beer – with 14th Star Brewing Co.

14th Star is Steve’s 1,200-square-foot nanobrewery on Lower Newton Street, in St. Albans City.

Nanobreweries make less than four-barrel batches, and as of your eyes hitting this paragraph, there are still less than 100 nanobreweries in America.

What makes 14th Star stand out? Well, it’s about the only brewery in Vermont that’s located above Burlington. Period.

But that’s not it. Not entirely.

You see – this is your beer. Oh, sure, Steve plans on starting you off with one-barrel batches of pale ale, brown ale, and Belgian white. There will be more, of course, but that’s up to you. So tell Steve what style beer you want in your 14th Star growler at: steve@14thstarbrewing.com.
On our end, we are readying to open our doors. Our goal is this July. (Check out our Pint of Progress on our home page.)

We can’t wait to watch you let your hair down and lift your glass, Vermont. We’ll enjoy that. And remember – this is your beer. You enjoy it.

data.name: 16 Mile Brewing Company
data.description:
16 Mile Brewing Company, Inc. opened its doors in July 2009 to the public. It is owned and operated by Brett McCrea and Chad Campbell.

The 16 Mile Brewing Company name harkens back to the late 1700’s when Georgetown was still known as Pettijohn’s old field, a rather isolated town, centrally located in Sussex County. The area was “16 miles from anywhere” in the county and was the best place for farmers, merchants, and politicians to meet to conduct official business. Georgetown replaced Lewes as the County Seat when numerous petitions were sent to Delaware’s General Assembly requesting that the move be made to accommodate all county residents. (For more information see “16 Miles from Anywhere: A History of Georgetown, Del., by William J. Wade.)

data.name: 18th Street Brewery
data.description: Hand-crafting small and big beers for NW Indiana and Chicagoland.

data.name: 192 Brewing Company
data.description: We began building our dream in 2007. We have improved our recipes, gathered feedback, made changes, and sampled our products. We have one concept. We want to Make great beer. Not beer that tastes like a bitter plant, or a leather belt. Not clear beer that has been mass produced and over filtered. Just wonderful, fantastic beer, for the many. All from a very small space. 192 square feet to be exact. We have packed only the essentials into our brewery. We make every batch by hand and we nurture it every step of the way. Great beer is what we work for, and great beer is what we enjoy.

data.name: 1974 Brewing Company
data.description: 1974 Brewing Company is a nano brewery in planning, founded in 2012. We began brewing in late 2008 on a hobby scale with all grain 5 gallon batches. In late 2011 we moved up to 10 gallon batches. Brewing is not only a hobby but a way of life for us, once we started we just couldn’t seem to stop. We really enjoy the process of making the beer as well the finished product. Some of the success we have had in home brewing competitions has only given us confidence and motivation to take our hobby further. We plan on expanding our system to produce 7-10 barrels per batch in 2012 as well as filing the necessary paperwork to begin a legitimate brewery, distributing our beers to the public.

data.name: 21st Amendment Brewery
data.description: The 21st Amendment Brewery offers a variety of award winning house made brews and American grilled cuisine in a comfortable loft like setting. Join us before and after Giants baseball games in our outdoor beer garden. A great location for functions and parties in our semi-private Brewers Loft. See you soon at the 21A!

data.name: 23rd Street Brewery
data.description:
Here at the 23rd Street Brewery, we pride ourselves in creating and offering ales and lagers of exceptional quality. Often in the micro brewing industry, quality is compromised for quantity. We brew handcrafted, small batch beers to ensure freshness is as crisp as it is clean. We use only the finest domestic and imported barley and hops to brew beers of tradition and beers of distinction. The brew house we call home is a 15 barrel Pub Brewing System located on the upper level of the impressive brewery interior. In the past year, we have doubled our production to exceed 1000 barrels (2000 Kegs) per year and have begun distributing to other bars and restaurants throughout Kansas. 

Bryan "Bucky" Buckingham, brew master of the 23rd Street Brewery, is creating mouth watering specialty beers and recently won a Silver Medal in the Irish Style Red Ale category at the 2007 Great American Beer Festival for Crimson Phog.

data.name: 2nd Shift Brewing Co
data.description: We are a micro that will be making beer that is big on flavor and aroma, the way beer should be. There will be several styles and a continuing line of seasonal and special beers that will be produced throughout the year.

data.name: 3 Guys and a Beer'd Brewing Company
data.description: We strive to make a quality, flavorful brew that all tastebuds will enjoy!

data.name: 3 Herons Brewing Company
data.description:
We will be opening the restaurant Friday, August 24, preparing for the NY brewery license after. 

We will offer fresh meats both outside in the BBQ and inside the restaurant. We will use local produce as much as we can, from local Finger Lakes farms. 

We will strive to be family-friendly in price & atmosphere, offering local favorites (BBQ etc) and quality musical entertainment.

Smoked meats, handmade sausage & cheese, homemade pasta & flatbreads.

Craft — Flavor — Quality

data.name: 3 Ravens Brewing
data.description:
3 Ravens began in 2003 out of necessity, when a local hotel stopped serving traditional English style cask conditioned 'Real Ale' from beer engines.

Faced with a critical lack of supply, a group of passionate engineers (led by home brewer Ben Pattison), built a microbrewery and accompanying bar downstairs and began handcrafting a range of their own "real ales" as small batch 300 litre brews. Hailed by the engineers and beer judges alike for their robust flavour, the ales received immediate return, taking Silver and Bronze medals at the Australian & International Beer Awards. 3 Ravens hit the shelves of local restaurants and bars and demand soon outgrew supply. In 2005, the brewery was upgraded to 1200 litres to help service a growing list of stockists and a swag of thirsty engineers!

data.name: 3 Sheeps Brewing Company
data.description:
All families have their stories: tales of grandparents and great-grandparents and the incredible things they accomplished, or lived through, or overcame. My family was no different. I grew up hearing stories that cascaded across a broad plain of topics, but the ones that fascinated me most centered around the Kingsbury Breweries.

Back in 1926, the Kingsbury Breweries, then known as the Gutsch Brewery, declared bankruptcy. It was a tough time for breweries across the country as Prohibition was in full effect. Many breweries failed during that time, and the Gutsch Brewery was on its way to joining them. It was at this time that my family took the helm of the brewery. Soon after, they changed the name to the Kingsbury Breweries, expanded coast-to-coast, and turned the brewery into what we remember it as today.

I grew up hearing stories from my father, who, as a child with his father, would go around the various Kingsbury Breweries, see the brewers hard at work, and watch the customers enjoy a beer in the Ratskellar. This is where my interest was first piqued by the great world of beer. Many years later, thanks to a brilliant gift on my wife’s part, I started making my own beer. From that point forward there was no turning back. The hobby turned into a passion, which turned into an obsession, which turned into quitting my day job and opening a brewery.

This is my Really Cool Waterslide - my choice to take a dream and make it my reality. Thank you to all those who have helped me get here.

- Grant Pauly, 3 Sheeps Brewing

data.name: 3 Stars Brewing Company
data.description:
3 Stars Brewing is a DC based production brewery founded by Mike McGarvey and Dave Coleman to provide the community with great, fresh, local craftbeer. 

We are looking forward to opening our doors in 2011. In doing so, we will proudly brew beers that push the limits of conventional brewing while still providing our customers with great, fresh, local craft beers...contact us at info@3starsbrewing.com

data.name: 3docs BrewHouse
data.description: Historians sometimes disagree as to the origin of the 3docs, but all agree on their mission to bring an impressive beer and spirits selection, while enjoying great live music, is a noble endeavor. Each member of the 3docs has been trained at birth to be an expert in the arts of liquid refreshment, brethren of the oldest and most prestigious society in the world — a society that is so secret, if it were revealed to you, the next thing you would hear would be a knock at the door, which would be followed by eternal enlightenment. But alas, I have said to much. To know the 3docs is to know their heart. Just as cavemen enjoyed fire, the 3docs hope that you will enjoy 3docs Brew House.

data.name: 3rd Wave Brewing Co.
data.description: 3rd Wave Brewing Co. is a dream between to friends who love the beach and love to brew beer. We hope you visit us often and enjoy Good Friends, Good Waves, Great Beer!

data.name: 4 Hands Brewing Company
data.description: 4 Hands Brewing Company, located in the LaSalle Park neighborhood, will provide the craft beer enthusiast a handcrafted portfolio inspired by the American craft movement that pushes the limits of creativity. Our barrel -aging program will produce a truly unique line on beers. The use of wine and spirit barrels containing an array of fruit, herbs, and spices in conjunction with wild yeast strains will enhance the flavors to produce a one of a kind beer.

data.name: 4 Paws Brewing
data.description:
4 Paws Brewing LLC is a microbrewery established in Chicago, IL. The brewery will be located in the Uptown/Edgewater neighborhood at a site to be determined. 4 Paws is hoping to be fully operational by 2013!

We believe in our company, what we stand for, and most of all the beers we serve. We would never make anything we wouldn't drink just to turn a profit and we would never say anything or do anything to compromise our core beliefs. We hope that our supporters and friends join us in believing in 4 Paws too!

So why 4 paws you might ask? The short answer is our little dog Sadie. Sadie is a rescue dog that we adopted over Memorial Day weekend of 2010. She's a big part of who we are and what we're all about. So that's how we got our name, but what are we all about?

data.name: 4 Pines Brewing Company
data.description:
“Handcrafted beer brewed naturally” means in a nutshell that when you drink our beer you are getting the best of natures goodness.

Drink beer, make it good beer, sip it slowly, so your tastebuds dance in your mouth.

data.name: 40 Arpent Brewing Company
data.description: Forty Arpent is a Louisiana Brewery using traditonal brewing techniques, with local ingredients, to make new flavor profiles uniqe to the Gulf Coast. Our take on an Irish Red Ale (Creole Red Bean And Rice Ale) will truly make Monday's Special something to look forward to.

data.name: 406 Brewing Company
data.description: 406 Brewing Company with brewer Matt Muth

data.name: 450 North Brewing Company
data.description: Owners David and Brenda Simmons had a plan to expand their winery business with a restaurant. Several of the wine customers are also beer drinkers. What better way to satisfy all customers than to offer fresh locally produced beer. Opening in Sept. of 2012, 450 North Brewing Company will open as a Brewpub with a full service restaurant.

data.name: 4th Street Brewing Co
data.description: Welcome to Gresham's favorite locally-owned brew pub and restaurant! Come check out our state of the art facility in the heart of downtown Gresham on the corner of 4th and Roberts. Whether you come for our locally brewed beer, our family-friendly restaurant, our incredible sports bar, or our unparalleled meeting space perfect for private parties, rehearsal dinners, meetings and more, 4th Street Brewing is the perfect choice for any occasion.

data.name: 4th Way Brewing Company
data.description: Microbrewery with a cafe to feature our wide range of beer styles matched with local organic eats.

data.name: 5 Points Brewing Co
data.description: 5 Points Brewing Co. is located at the Historic Mission Brewery Plaza in San Diego. Built in 1913 as the Mission Brewing Company, the brewery operated until the eve of Prohibition in 1919. 5 Points Brewing Co. has restored the brewing tradition at this great location and is proud to serve fresh Ales and Lagers to thirsty craft beer enthusiasts. We keep 10 brewery fresh beers on tap at all times with seasonal and specialty beer available throughout the year. Our tasting area is located in the brewery so you can enjoy a real craft beer experience, right where it happens! Our team looks forward to sharing our brewery and beer with you, Cheers!

data.name: 5 Rabbit Cerveceria Inc
data.description: The first Latin microbrewery in the US, 5 Rabbit is all about making the best beer. At 5 Rabbit we celebrate the centuries-old myth behind Latin drinking culture with an innovative concept that revolves that uniquely Latin attitude towards life that has so captured the imagination of the world. It additionally sets out to become an integral part of the local Hispanic community and aid in its advancement. 5 Rabbit is locally brewed in Chicago, Illinois.

data.name: 5 Seasons Brewing Company
data.description: 5 Seasons Brewing is passionate about serving local produce, all-natural meats, and artisanal cheeses. We believe in conserving the spirit of the farm and supporting local farmers. We are also acknowledged as the center of Atlanta’s beer culture.

data.name: 50 Back Brewing Company
data.description:
Our entire purpose is to say "Thank you" to all of the active Troops and Veterans in our Country who have served so selflessly to protect and preserve our dear Nation and precious Freedom! Of course, our gratitude began close to our hearts with our own fathers, grand-fathers and uncles, and quickly spread to friends, neighbors, and colleagues.

We searched for a way to carry out our goal, we decided to find an avenue that would facilitate wide-spread reception and the ability to give back repeatedly. What better way than a great tasting lager? As predicted, the reception to our mission has, indeed, been overwhelmingly positive and dynamic. As we share our idea, everyone invariably expresses their gratitude for the fact that we are providing a manner in which they can give back on an individual and personal level. Surprisingly, Troops and Veterans have said "Thank you" back to us!

data.name: 508 Gastrobrewery
data.description: 508 Restaurant and Brewery, Bar and Mediterranean American Rustic Cuisine SOHO, NY

data.name: 51 North Brewing Company
data.description: Attention Beer Lovers, what you've been hearing is true! Lake Orion is about to have its very own microbrewery – 51 North Brewing Company. We will be located at 51 North Broadway, hence the name. Mary and Don Gindhart lead a small group of beer-loving, business-minded individuals that share one purpose – to create a microbrewery like no other. We will have an amazing lineup of hand-crafted beers, wines and meads, all made in-house. Along with this diverse group of drink selections, we will offer unique food pairings to complement these libations and provide high-quality entertainment and service. All these ingredients add up to a destination perfect for individuals, couples, families and friends.

data.name: 515 Brewing Company
data.description: Exceptional Folks Drink Exceptional Beer

data.name: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro
data.description: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro is located in Greenville Michigan. We are excited to bring this new establishment to our community. We feature our own locally brewed beers on site, and our Bistro features a full menu of American Cuisine from appetizers, soups & salads, Burgers, Sandwiches, Entrees & Desserts. We opened in late October 2012! Stop in and see us soon

data.name: 5th Street Brewpub
data.description: Opened in June of 2003 in historic Downtown Sedalia, Missouri. The 5th Street Brewpub is a restaurant with a full bar featuring our own handcrafted beers. Our brewing system came on-line in February 2005. We have pale and red ales, a great dark porter, and are currently producing other seasonal beers. We are also proud to serve the major brands brews as well as specialty brews from other handcrafting breweries.

data.name: 603 Brewery
data.description:
The Brewery’s Founding Principles:

Good People Create Good Beer
Support Local, Drink Local
Reduce, Reuse, Recycle
Pay It Forward
There is always room for Improvement

data.name: 612 Brew
data.description:
At 612Brew, the newest beer company in the 612, we want to make your newest favorite beer you’ve never had.

With our operation moving to a larger location in Uptown, we have the opportunity to make and test out much larger batches of hand crafted beer and present them for you to try. You never know what we may brew next, a Porter, a Pilsner, a Bock or a Belgian. We are excited for each new beer that we make and hope you get excited to try them.

data.name: 7 Seas Brewing Company
data.description:
Formed in 2008 by Travis Guterson and Mike Runion, 7 Seas Brewing is an innovative craft brewery, making audacious, yet technically well-executed beers; utilizing cans rather than bottles; and championing environmental stewardship.

Having survived a fire at our original location which delayed our opening by six months, we now occupy a 3,000 square foot brewing facility superbly located in Gig Harbor, Washington.

At 7 Seas Brewing we strive to brew, innovate and perfect the Ultimate Proper Pint, one that will invoke an emotional, contemplative response from the drinker. It should cause them to smile, knowing that in our homogenized, cookie cutter world of consumerism, there are still people crafting something of integrity and authenticity.

data.name: 75th Street Brewery
data.description:
75th Street Brewery is Kansas City’s first and best brewpub that opened its doors in 1993.  Located in the historic Waldo district, the Brewery is home to live, local music (including Kansas City’s own Brew Jam every Sunday, and live Bluegrass music every Wednesday).

The Brewery boasts award-winning hand-crafted beers (fresh growlers to go every day) and a made-from-scratch menu. 75th Street Brewery has received local, regional, and national awards and accolades, including the 1999 Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup for the Red-Eye Rye Beer.

75th Street Brewery features beers brewed from the great traditions of England, Germany, Ireland, and Czechoslovakia. We also offer special seasonal styles with influences from around the globe. Each of our beers is produced from the finest barley and hops in the world and includes only four basic ingredients: Barley, Hops, Yeast, and Water. No additives or preservatives are used. Because our beers are handcrafted in small batches and kept cold, no preservatives or pasteurization are required. You are guaranteed a fresh and natural pint of beer every time. Cheers!

data.name: 7venth Sun Brewing
data.description: Belgian-style beer, IPAs, second use spirit barrel aged beer, oak aged sour beer.
